availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Paul C. King (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Harrison County, Kentucky, native. Son of Joshua King and Elizabeth King. Married to Mary J. Simpson King in Harrison County, Kentucky, on June 8, 1854. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 104.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 368.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 124.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Richland District, p. 21.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058, Harrison County Marriages
